a1278adb-0f67-4191-baa6-65df380d7373.description: Earners of this badge have participated in a recruitment panel for either Barnardos, The Local Authority or Health Service. The earner of the badge has participated in preparing interview questions; in welcoming applicants; in asking and assessing interview questions. The earner of the badge has worked collaboratively with service leaders to decide on the best applicant for the job.
a1278adb-0f67-4191-baa6-65df380d7373.name: Barnardos Staff Selection and Recruitment Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners show consistency in their approach and can apply knowledge with real world context to receive feedback and develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Worked collaboratively with service leaders to select the best candidate for a job using safe recruitment and equal opportunity prinicples
Worked with a group of young people to design interview questions and to assess responses using an established criteria.
Earners must be part of Barnardo’s Hype Project
Prideaux Court. Palace St. Plymouth PL1 2AY

f8233197-2475-4b01-9d54-2c13c155c7d3.description: Earners of this badge were under 25 years old and used their lived experience to present at a staff training program or presented at an event. Earners will have helped staff gain an improved understanding of young people’s health; young people’s circumstances or to improve staff understanding of children’s rights or service user involvement.
f8233197-2475-4b01-9d54-2c13c155c7d3.name: Barnardos HYPE Service Training & Presenting Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: The earner has demonstrated they can apply knowledge with real world context and have gained experience, consistently and applied feedback they have received in order to develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will have been part of planning a training workshop or event
Earners of this badge have demonstrated their ability to work as part of a team with other trainers and presenters
Earners of this badge will have attended a training workshop and presented some of the learning material
Earners of this badge will have engaged in discussions to support other people’s learning and development
This is an open badge.
Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

fc7ee1dd-11f8-4f2a-bede-b73d74eb6abb.description: Earners of this badge have attended a training event to prepare them to recruit staff for Barnardo’s, the local authority or health service. The badge evidences that young people understand equal opportunities at interview; welcoming applicants; understand how decisions are made and the importance of recruiting staff who can relate to and engage service users.
fc7ee1dd-11f8-4f2a-bede-b73d74eb6abb.name: Barnardo’s Staff Selection Training Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has attended a training event
Earner has demonstrated an openness to learn about safe recruitment and demonstrated a commitment to equal opportunities
Earners must be part of Barnardo’s Hype Project
Prideaux Court. Palace St. Plymouth PL1 2AY

0d9d575f-2abd-4560-83b6-7b115234d055.description: Earners of this badge will use their lived experience to design and carry out a research project with their peers. Earners of this badge will form a question to support the improvement of health services and design a set of questions to consult with their peers. Earners of this badge will analyse the findings and identify key priorities for health services to take forward.
0d9d575f-2abd-4560-83b6-7b115234d055.name: Barnardo’s HYPE Community Research Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: The earner has demonstrated they can apply knowledge with real world context and have gained experience, consistently and applied feedback they have received in order to develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will have used their lived experience to set a key question for peer research
Earners of this badge will have planned a set of questions for peer research and thought about research methods as part of a team
Earners of the badge demonstrate teamwork skills with Barnardos colleagues and young people
Earners of the badge have been part of analysing findings and identifying key priorities from the research
This is an open badge.
Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

aff5486f-fb6a-47b6-8824-42efc0ed4b4e.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated their skills in recruiting and selecting candidates for Barnardo’s, local authorities and health staff. They have recruited staff for a minimum of 6 months and 5 interview panels. They have learnt to work as a team, create interview questions/tests from a young person’s perspective and made assessments of candidates based on equal opportunity principles and helped recruits feel at ease during the process. This is a demonstrate badge by Cities of Learning.
aff5486f-fb6a-47b6-8824-42efc0ed4b4e.name: Barnardo’s Staff Selection & Recruitment Expert

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners show consistency in their approach and can apply knowledge with real world context to receive feedback and develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will have contributed to recruiting staff for a minimum of 6 months and on a minimum of 5 interview panels.

Earners of this badge have demonstrated their ability to work as part of a team with other young people and with service leaders. As well as creating questions and other interview tests for candidates.
Earners of this badge have championed the perspective of young people with lived experience. They have also welcomed candidates and helped them feel at ease.
Earners of this badge have made assessments of candidates based on clear criteria and equal opportunity principles.
Earners must be part of Barnardo’s Hype Project
Prideaux Court. Palace St. Plymouth PL1 2AY

209bd0e7-94d6-46f9-be3c-a4037151350c.description: Earners of this badge will have taken party in creative activity which will have led to them getting a feel for a creative practice and contributing to the creation of some creative content. Young people will have understood the power of creative practice as a medium for sharing their views and will have understood the potential of participation in creative practice for supporting creative thinking and communication.
209bd0e7-94d6-46f9-be3c-a4037151350c.name: Get Creative With Barnardos HYPE

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Participate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participate Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners meet expectations, can interact with learning and are able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has worked on a piece of creative content that expresses their views or feelings
Earner has shown an openness to learn about creative art based projects and used this as vehicle for expression.
Earner will have reflected on the transferable skills they have gained through engaging in creative process.
Earners must be part of Barnardo’s Hype Project
Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

00d4b88e-ca37-4ce7-9aa6-1c8943520c7a.description: Earners of this badge have presented staff training programmes or events and will have used their lived experience to contribute to these. They have an improved understanding of a range of issues affecting young people and service users. Earners reflected on feedback and developed training programmes as a result, showed confidence to lead an activity or presentation themselves and understanding of how training programmes fit together and how to create the right environment for good learning.
00d4b88e-ca37-4ce7-9aa6-1c8943520c7a.name: Barnardos HYPE Training & Presenting Badge - Expert

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge will have been part of planning a minimum of 3 training workshops or events. They have an improved understanding of young people’s health; circumstances and/or understanding of children’s rights or service user involvement.

Earners of this badge have demonstrated their ability to work as part of a team with other trainers and presenters. Young people will have reviewed feedback from their delivery and made improvements as a result.
Earners of this will have been supported to develop their own part of a program and take the lead in delivery.

Earners of this badge will demonstrate an understanding of how people learn and support creating an environment that supports learning e.g. understanding learning agreements; creating a safe and comfortable learning environment; providing a range of activities for different learning styles.
This is an open badge.
Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

f2008c33-4f8f-4878-a686-05618d2e9b58.description: Earners of this badge have delivered a creative project, including environmental art, that has used creativity as a means of expression. This could involve but is not limited to editing the HYPE blog, making films, visual art, creative writing or drama to convey messages important to children, young people and their families. Earners of the badge will have worked as part of a group to plan and deliver their project from start to finish. This activity is supported by staff or volunteers.
f2008c33-4f8f-4878-a686-05618d2e9b58.name: Barnardo’s HYPE Art and Creativity Project

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.description: The earner has demonstrated they can apply knowledge with real world context and have gained experience, consistently and applied feedback they have received in order to develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will have completed a creative project using the creative process as a vehicle for self expression
Earners will have demonstrated collaboration and communication skills when planning and delivering a project as part of a group
Earners have individually created, directed, curated or edited content as part of the wider project
Earners have had their work displayed, exhibited or launched at an event or in a public space.
Earners must be part of Barnardos HYPE Project.
Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

b195492b-2389-4d81-b6e7-889b846226fe.description: Earners of this badge have attended a meeting and demonstrated interest in getting more involved with HYPE. The HYPE service provides young people with opportunities to create change in children’s community health services including mental health services, public health nursing, paediatrics and allied health professionals. Opportunities include art workshops; writing blogs, recruitment panels, consultations, making presentations, peer support groups.
b195492b-2389-4d81-b6e7-889b846226fe.name: Getting Involved With HYPE - First Engagement Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Barnardos and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has attended a meeting or event with the HYPE team
Earner has shown interest in getting involved with HYPE

Four Greens Community Trust, Whitleigh Green, Plymouth PL5 4DD

32f845e7-f20c-4d3e-bd3c-f5af5eda8e5f.description: Earners of this Cities of Learning badge have demonstrated their skills in advocacy by engaging in a Barnardo's project designed to influence policy, service delivery or attitudes. They will have attended a series of events during which they will have articulated the views of the group they represent and applied the knowledge of their own lived experience in a professional context. They will have consistently utilised their communication skills and contributed to the process in a meaningful way.

Has communicated issues relating to their or their peers lived experience effectively in a professional environment

They can assess the impact of training via feedback and observation and develop the programme accordingly

65a09942-ebbc-43d9-8809-97ad0b970875.description: Earners of this badge have shown leadership by supporting and mentoring young people, presenting the service to others, and introducing them to groups. Earners have taken responsibility for a participation project including independent communication with partner organisations or services. They are also confident to lead group or training activities with both young people and professionals
Earners of this badge have shown they can contribute ideas and influence service development and work collaboratively as a member of the Barnardos HYPE service staff team.
Earners of this badge can reflect on experience, identify learning needs, and show commitment to ongoing personal development.

e246b0d1-dc1c-454a-b2e8-906e2b264227.description: Earners of this Cities of Learning badge have demonstrated their community activism by completing social action project supported by Barnardo's. They have applied their knowledge of social action and community activism by delivering of a project from ideas phase through to completion. The earner has utilised their knowledge and skills to have meaningful benefit to the community they wanted to change. They will have received feedback and developed a consistent approach to effective social action.
